content: ribs n cables beanie by anne g the ribbing and cables make this hat very stretchy and adaptable size wise the smaller needles make for a dense knit to keep your head warm this winter sizes adult s/m l/x-l fits head circumference 21/22 23/24 inches around materials  size 4mm 6 us 16 circular needles and double pointed needles or size needed for gauge  approx 105 115 metres 115 125 yds for single brim or 130 160 metres 140 175 yds for folded brim of worsted / aran weight yarn samples are shown in cascade 220 lion brand heartland vanna s choice and bernat premium  cable needle  one stitch marker and yarn needle gauge 22 stitches and 28 rounds in 2 x 2 rib stitch * because of the ribbing this hat is very stretchy and forgiving so you don t need to worry about the stitch gauge the row count however is important to achieve the right length for your hat if need be you can make adjustments by changing needle size and/or ribbing length on the bottom notes - i like the long-tail cast-on also known as continental cast-on because of its elasticity tutorial video here http //www knittinghelp com/video/play/long-tail-cast-on - this hat is knit brim to crown charts are worked from right to left each round of both the charted and the written instructions must be repeated around for a total of four times four sections key & abbreviations co -
